attributes.comment:
We're all well aware that out country faces steep challenges regarding immigration
reform. There are so many factors to consider, including the safety of U.S.
residents and the well-being of those seeking shelter in our country. According to
the DHS Immigration yearbook most immigrants come to the U.S. seeking to be
with their family, for work, or as refugees or asylees. If you couldn't provide for
your family in your home country, what would you do? If your child lived in the
U.S. would you emmigrate from home to be with him or her?

If we want to know who is in our country, and if we want to live up to the invitation
on the Statue of Liberty, "Give me your tired, your poor, your huddled masses
yearning to breathe free" then we need to make it more realistic for immigrants to
be legal. An increase in fees does NOT make it easier for law-abiding, hard-
working human beings to do so. The money can come from somewhere else,
from a source that is more capable of paying.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Audrey N. Straus
